child.tree-val: Central Plateau, subtree of Niger-Congo: Ethnologue 2009
child.pub-comments: The language is ‘Nkarigwe’ or ‘Rigwe’, the people are ‘Nnerigwe’ or ‘Miyango’.
child.geography: Nigeria: Plateau state, Bassa and Barakin Ladi LGAs; Kaduna state, Saminaka LGA.
child.alt-names: Aregwe, Idafan, Iregwe, Kwal, Kwan, Kwoll, Miango, Nkarigwe, Nnerigwe, Nyango, Rigwe
child.publications: Lewis, M. Paul (ed.). 2009. Ethnologue: Languages of the World, 16 edn. http://www.ethnologue.com/home.asp. (15 February, 2011.)

child.tree-val: Central Plateau, subtree of Niger-Congo: Ethnologue 2009
child.pub-comments: The language is called ‘Izarek’, ‘Izere’, or ‘Izer’; a speaker ‘Bajari’, the people ‘Jarawa’, ‘Afizarek’, ‘Afizere’, ‘Afudelek’, ‘Fizere’, ‘Feserek’, ‘Fezere’, ‘Hill Jarawa’, ‘Jarawan Dutse’. ‘Jos-Zarazon’ is the name of indigenous speakers in Jos.
child.geography: Nigeria: South Izere: Plateau state, Barikin Ladi LGA; North, Northeast Izere: Plateau state, Jos LGA; Bauchi state, Toro LGA; and Kaduna state, Jema’a LGA.
child.alt-names: Afizare, Afizarek, Afusare, Feserek, Fezere, Fizere, Hill Jarawa, Izarek, Jarawa, Jarawan Dutse, Jari, Jos-Zarazon
child.publications: Lewis, M. Paul (ed.). 2009. Ethnologue: Languages of the World, 16 edn. http://www.ethnologue.com/home.asp. (15 February, 2011.)
